intro: Daucus meifolius, commonly known as the meadow carrot, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes other familiar plants like parsley and carrots. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, white to pinkish flowers arranged in umbels. Its fruit is a dry, two-lobed structure that contains the seeds. Daucus meifolius is typically found in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and roadsides.
